info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 10:16PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... At 1013 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a snow band from Sandy to near Ellwood City. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARDS...A line of heavy snow, accompanied by winds of 25 MPH, can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. SOURCE...Radar and surface observations. IMPACT...Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Butler, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Punxsutawney, Monaca, Vandergrift, Kittanning, and Rimersburg. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 45. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 68 and 101. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.
